An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting a malicious XML file to disclose information, execute server side request forgery (SSRF) or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.Spring Framework is vulnerable to XML external entity (XXE) injection due to insufficient security controls. An attacker could obtain sensitive information from system files by providing the application with a crafted XML document.This issue is present in multiple parts of spring framework, StAX `XMLInputFactory`, `SourceHttpMessageConverter`, and the Spring OXM wrapper using the `JAXB marshaller`. these issues are all problems with external entity resolution not being disabled, and use the CVEs: 

CVE-2013-6429
CVE-2013-7315
CVE-2013-4152

These issues were all worked on and were supposedly fixed in Jan 2014 (version **4.0.0** and version **3.2.5**), however it was later revealed that the fixes for these issues were incomplete, with a new CVE being assigned: CVE-2014-0054. The incorrect fix was corrected in versions **3.2.8** and **4.0.2**.An XML external entities (XXE) vulnerability has been discovered in Spring Framework. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting a malicious XML file to disclosure sensitive information, execute server side request forgery (SSRF) or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.Spring Framework is vulnerable to directory traversal due to the incorrect sanitization of client-provided URLs. An attacker could use crafted URL parameters to access any file on the system which is accessible to the process in which the Spring web application is running.Spring MVC is vulnerable to XML external entity (XXE) injection as it does not disable external entity expansion by default and does not offer a way of disabling it manually. An attacker can leverage this flaw by sending crafted XML input to the server which may trick the XML parser into performing arbitrary operations on local resources that the attacker should not be able to control. This can lead to several problems ranging from an attacker being able to run stealth scans by bypassing the firewall, through sensitive information disclosure and denial-of-service (DoS), to server side request forgery (SSRF).

This CVE covers an incomplete fix to CVE-2013-7315.

NOTE: The fix to CVE-2013-6429 has also turned out to be incomplete (see BDSA-2014-0002 for details).Spring Framework is vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) due to a default action in Spring MVC that allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML to steal user's cookies.Spring Framework and Spring MVC are vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) due to a failure of a method to escape certain special characters from user-supplied input. In some cases it could result in an attacker being able to inject arbitrary web scripts and steal a user's session cookies.Spring Framework is vulnerable to a reflected file download (RFD) attack. An attacker can craft and send a URL with a `.bat` extension to a victim that results in the response being downloaded rather than rendered. Some input may also be reflected in the response.Spring Framework is vulnerable to path traversal. Paths provided to the `Resourceservlet` were not properly sanitized and as a result exposed to directory traversal attacks. `ResourceServlet` is now deprecated and `ResourceHttpRequestHandler` (and related classes) have superseded it.Pivotal's Spring Framework contains an unsafe Java deserialization vulnerability. If the Spring Framework library's `HttpInvokerServiceExporter` is being used to deserialize client data, it may be possible for a remote attacker to perform remote code execution (RCE) on systems using Spring Framework.

**Note:** All versions prior to **6.0.0-M1** (Which is a pre-release) contain the functionality that may lead to deserialization attacks depending on how the library is implemented in the product.Spring Framework is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied input. Potential attackers can leverage this flaw to run arbitrary code on the target system by sending crafted messages.Spring Framework is vulnerable to directory traversal due to the way static content can be loaded. Potential attackers could leverage this flaw to gain unauthorized access to sensitive files on Windows hosts.Spring Framework is vulnerable to privilege escalation due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input. Crafted input from a remote client can be used to exploit a flaw in the way that servers running the affected software communicate with each other. This is because communication between the servers uses that user-supplied input for building requests.Spring Framework is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied input. Potential attackers can leverage this flaw to run arbitrary code on the target system by sending crafted messages. Original remediation was not implemented correctly for the 4.3.x branch.Spring Framework has a flaw in the manipulation of regular expressions within the spring-messaging module. An attacker can send a specially crafted message to the simple STOMP broker that will trigger a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS).A cross-site tracing (*XST*) vulnerability has been discovered in spring framework. The application allows obscure request methods, such as TRACE and TRACK. These HTTP methods can be used with an existing cross-site scripting (*XSS*) vulnerability to escalate to an XST vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this by utilizing an XSS vulnerability to bypass cookie protection and steal sensitive data.It was discovered that Spring Framework was vulnerable to RFD protection bypass. In some instances, depending on the browser used, an attacker could bypass the RFD attack protections via the use of a `jsessionid` path parameter.Spring Security contains an uncontrolled resource consumption vulnerability. Attackers could exploit this to create an `OutOfMemory` error and exhaust  system resources, triggering a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.Spring Framework is vulnerable to log file injection due to the insufficient validation of user input in an undisclosed component. An attacker could leverage this issue in order to add arbitrary entries to a log file which could impact both the integrity issues and performance issues.

**Note**: a follow-up to this issue was disclosed as **CVE-2021-22060** (**BDSA-2021-3236**), with further fixed releases that protect against additional types of input and in more places of the Spring Framework codebase.Spring Framework is vulnerable to log file injection due to the insufficient validation of user input in an undisclosed component. An attacker could leverage this issue in order to add arbitrary entries to a log file which could impact both the integrity issues and performance issues.

**Note**: the vendor states this issue exists as a follow up to CVE-2021-22096 (BDSA-2022-0011) that protects against additional types of input and in more places of the Spring Framework codebase.Software systems using Spring Framework may be vulnerable to unsafe deserialization if they employ unsafe use of certain provided deserialization functionality. A remote attacker could potentially execute arbitrary code on a vulnerable endpoint by passing a maliciously crafted serialized object to that endpoint.

**Note**: This issue only affects software that has been written to leverage specific deserialization functionality provided by the Spring Framework without sanitization.Spring Framework is vulnerable to a flaw in the access restrictions to the security sensitive `ClassLoader` property. The restrictions can be bypassed through alternative paths available with Java9 and later. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to cause remote code execution (RCE).

**Note** this issue exists because the restrictions that were introduced to prevent exploitation of BDSA-2010-0001 (CVE-2010-1622) can be bypassed on platforms where Java9 and later are in use.

This vulnerability is listed as exploitable by the Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency in their [Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog](https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog).Spring Framework is vulnerable to data binding protection bypass due to improper validation of specified disallowed fields in `DataBinders`. This could be leveraged by an attacker to bypass the suggested workaround to **CVE-2022-22965** (**BDSA-2022-0858**) if it is improperly implemented.Spring Security contains a flaw when dealing with OAuth2 access token empty scope list  responses. A remote attacker could leverage this to escalate their privileges under **all** the following conditions being met:

* They act as the role of a Login Client (e.g. uses `http.oauth2Login()`).
* They use one or more authorization rules with authorities mapped from authorized scopes (e.g. `anyRequest().hasAuthority("SCOPE_message.write")`) in the client application.
* An authorization server that responds with empty scopes list is registered (RFC 6749, Section 5.1).

**Note:** The role of Resource Servers (`http.oauth2ResourceServer()`) and applications that do not map authorization rules from authorized scopes (eg. `anyRequest().hasAuthority("ROLE_USER")`) cannot be exploited by this vulnerability.Spring Framework is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via specially crafted SpEL expressions. An attacker could exploit this issue by passing a crafted SpEL expression to the application which may result in a crash.Spring Framework is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via specially crafted SpEL expressions.This vulnerability is an expression language injection issue and affects VMware SpringSource Spring Framework  when a container supports Expression Language (EL) and evaluates EL expressions in tags twice, allowing remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via multiple attributes to carry out Expression Language Injection.Spring Framework contains a deserialization flaw. This could be exploited to bypass intended security restrictions. If successful, the attacker could pass and execute arbitrary commands on the vulnerable system.Spring Security is vulnerable to carriage return, line feeds (CRLF) injection in the logout functionality. Remote attackers can inject arbitrary HTTP headers and conduct HTTP response splitting attacks via the `spring-security-redirect` parameter.An XML External Entity (XXE) vulnerability has been discovered in Spring Framework. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting a malicious XML file to disclose information, execute server side request forgery (SSRF) or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.Spring Framework is vulnerable to XML external entity (XXE) injection due to insufficient security controls. An attacker could obtain sensitive information from system files by providing the application with a crafted XML document.This issue is present in multiple parts of spring framework, StAX `XMLInputFactory`, `SourceHttpMessageConverter`, and the Spring OXM wrapper using the `JAXB marshaller`. these issues are all problems with external entity resolution not being disabled, and use the CVEs: 

CVE-2013-6429
CVE-2013-7315
CVE-2013-4152

These issues were all worked on and were supposedly fixed in Jan 2014 (version **4.0.0** and version **3.2.5**), however it was later revealed that the fixes for these issues were incomplete, with a new CVE being assigned: CVE-2014-0054. The incorrect fix was corrected in versions **3.2.8** and **4.0.2**.An XML external entities (XXE) vulnerability has been discovered in Spring Framework. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting a malicious XML file to disclosure sensitive information, execute server side request forgery (SSRF) or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.Spring Framework is vulnerable to directory traversal due to the incorrect sanitization of client-provided URLs. An attacker could use crafted URL parameters to access any file on the system which is accessible to the process in which the Spring web application is running.

This can lead to several problems ranging from an attacker being able to run stealth scans by bypassing the firewall, through sensitive information disclosure and denial-of-service (DoS), to server side request forgery (SSRF).

This CVE covers an incomplete fix to CVE-2013-7315.

NOTE: The fix to CVE-2013-6429 has also turned out to be incomplete (see BDSA-2014-0002 for details).Spring Framework is vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) due to a default action in Spring MVC that allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML to steal user's cookies.Spring Framework and Spring MVC are vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) due to a failure of a method to escape certain special characters from user-supplied input. In some cases it could result in an attacker being able to inject arbitrary web scripts and steal a user's session cookies.Spring Framework is vulnerable to a reflected file download (RFD) attack. An attacker can craft and send a URL with a `.bat` extension to a victim that results in the response being downloaded rather than rendered. Some input may also be reflected in the response.Spring Framework is vulnerable to path traversal. Paths provided to the `Resourceservlet` were not properly sanitized and as a result exposed to directory traversal attacks. `ResourceServlet` is now deprecated and `ResourceHttpRequestHandler` (and related classes) have superseded it.Pivotal's Spring Framework contains an unsafe Java deserialization vulnerability. If the Spring Framework library's `HttpInvokerServiceExporter` is being used to deserialize client data, it may be possible for a remote attacker to perform remote code execution (RCE) on systems using Spring Framework.

**Note:** All versions prior to **6.0.0-M1** (Which is a pre-release) contain the functionality that may lead to deserialization attacks depending on how the library is implemented in the product.Spring Framework is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied input. Potential attackers can leverage this flaw to run arbitrary code on the target system by sending crafted messages.Spring Framework is vulnerable to directory traversal due to the way static content can be loaded. Potential attackers could leverage this flaw to gain unauthorized access to sensitive files on Windows hosts.Spring Framework is vulnerable to privilege escalation due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input. Crafted input from a remote client can be used to exploit a flaw in the way that servers running the affected software communicate with each other. This is because communication between the servers uses that user-supplied input for building requests.Spring Framework is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied input. Potential attackers can leverage this flaw to run arbitrary code on the target system by sending crafted messages. Original remediation was not implemented correctly for the 4.3.x branch.Spring Framework has a flaw in the manipulation of regular expressions within the spring-messaging module. An attacker can send a specially crafted message to the simple STOMP broker that will trigger a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS).A cross-site tracing (*XST*) vulnerability has been discovered in spring framework. The application allows obscure request methods, such as TRACE and TRACK. These HTTP methods can be used with an existing cross-site scripting (*XSS*) vulnerability to escalate to an XST vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this by utilizing an XSS vulnerability to bypass cookie protection and steal sensitive data.It was discovered that Spring Framework was vulnerable to RFD protection bypass. In some instances, depending on the browser used, an attacker could bypass the RFD attack protections via the use of a `jsessionid` path parameter.Spring Security contains an uncontrolled resource consumption vulnerability. Attackers could exploit this to create an `OutOfMemory` error and exhaust  system resources, triggering a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.Spring Framework is vulnerable to log file injection due to the insufficient validation of user input in an undisclosed component. An attacker could leverage this issue in order to add arbitrary entries to a log file which could impact both the integrity issues and performance issues.

**Note**: a follow-up to this issue was disclosed as **CVE-2021-22060** (**BDSA-2021-3236**), with further fixed releases that protect against additional types of input and in more places of the Spring Framework codebase.Spring Framework is vulnerable to log file injection due to the insufficient validation of user input in an undisclosed component. An attacker could leverage this issue in order to add arbitrary entries to a log file which could impact both the integrity issues and performance issues.

**Note**: the vendor states this issue exists as a follow up to CVE-2021-22096 (BDSA-2022-0011) that protects against additional types of input and in more places of the Spring Framework codebase.Software systems using Spring Framework may be vulnerable to unsafe deserialization if they employ unsafe use of certain provided deserialization functionality. A remote attacker could potentially execute arbitrary code on a vulnerable endpoint by passing a maliciously crafted serialized object to that endpoint.

**Note**: This issue only affects software that has been written to leverage specific deserialization functionality provided by the Spring Framework without sanitization.Spring Framework is vulnerable to a flaw in the access restrictions to the security sensitive `ClassLoader` property. The restrictions can be bypassed through alternative paths available with Java9 and later. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to cause remote code execution (RCE).

**Note** this issue exists because the restrictions that were introduced to prevent exploitation of BDSA-2010-0001 (CVE-2010-1622) can be bypassed on platforms where Java9 and later are in use.

This vulnerability is listed as exploitable by the Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency in their [Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog](https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog).Spring Framework is vulnerable to data binding protection bypass due to improper validation of specified disallowed fields in `DataBinders`. This could be leveraged by an attacker to bypass the suggested workaround to **CVE-2022-22965** (**BDSA-2022-0858**) if it is improperly implemented.Spring Security contains a flaw when dealing with OAuth2 access token empty scope list  responses. A remote attacker could leverage this to escalate their privileges under **all** the following conditions being met:

* They act as the role of a Login Client (e.g. uses `http.oauth2Login()`).
* They use one or more authorization rules with authorities mapped from authorized scopes (e.g. `anyRequest().hasAuthority("SCOPE_message.write")`) in the client application.
* An authorization server that responds with empty scopes list is registered (RFC 6749, Section 5.1).

**Note:** The role of Resource Servers (`http.oauth2ResourceServer()`) and applications that do not map authorization rules from authorized scopes (eg. `anyRequest().hasAuthority("ROLE_USER")`) cannot be exploited by this vulnerability.Spring Framework is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via specially crafted SpEL expressions. An attacker could exploit this issue by passing a crafted SpEL expression to the application which may result in a crash.Spring Framework is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via specially crafted SpEL expressions.This vulnerability is an expression language injection issue and affects VMware SpringSource Spring Framework  when a container supports Expression Language (EL) and evaluates EL expressions in tags twice, allowing remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via multiple attributes to carry out Expression Language Injection.Spring Framework contains a deserialization flaw. This could be exploited to bypass intended security restrictions. If successful, the attacker could pass and execute arbitrary commands on the vulnerable system.Spring Security is vulnerable to carriage return, line feeds (CRLF) injection in the logout functionality. Remote attackers can inject arbitrary HTTP headers and conduct HTTP response splitting attacks via the `spring-security-redirect` parameter.An XML External Entity (XXE) vulnerability has been discovered in Spring Framework. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting a malicious XML file to disclose information, execute server side request forgery (SSRF) or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.Spring Framework is vulnerable to XML external entity (XXE) injection due to insufficient security controls. An attacker could obtain sensitive information from system files by providing the application with a crafted XML document.This issue is present in multiple parts of spring framework, StAX `XMLInputFactory`, `SourceHttpMessageConverter`, and the Spring OXM wrapper using the `JAXB marshaller`. these issues are all problems with external entity resolution not being disabled, and use the CVEs: 

CVE-2013-6429
CVE-2013-7315
CVE-2013-4152

These issues were all worked on and were supposedly fixed in Jan 2014 (version **4.0.0** and version **3.2.5**), however it was later revealed that the fixes for these issues were incomplete, with a new CVE being assigned: CVE-2014-0054. The incorrect fix was corrected in versions **3.2.8** and **4.0.2**.An XML external entities (XXE) vulnerability has been discovered in Spring Framework. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting a malicious XML file to disclosure sensitive information, execute server side request forgery (SSRF) or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.Spring Framework is vulnerable to directory traversal due to the incorrect sanitization of client-provided URLs. An attacker could use crafted URL parameters to access any file on the system which is accessible to the process in which the Spring web application is running.Spring MVC is vulnerable to XML external entity (XXE) injection as it does not disable external entity expansion by default and does not offer a way of disabling it manually. An attacker could leverage this issue in order to add arbitrary entries to a log file which could impact both the integrity issues and performance issues.

**Note**: a follow-up to this issue was disclosed as **CVE-2021-22060** (**BDSA-2021-3236**), with further fixed releases that protect against additional types of input and in more places of the Spring Framework codebase.Spring Framework is vulnerable to log file injection due to the insufficient validation of user input in an undisclosed component. An attacker could leverage this issue in order to add arbitrary entries to a log file which could impact both the integrity issues and performance issues.

**Note**: the vendor states this issue exists as a follow up to CVE-2021-22096 (BDSA-2022-0011) that protects against additional types of input and in more places of the Spring Framework codebase.Software systems using Spring Framework may be vulnerable to unsafe deserialization if they employ unsafe use of certain provided deserialization functionality. A remote attacker could potentially execute arbitrary code on a vulnerable endpoint by passing a maliciously crafted serialized object to that endpoint.

**Note**: This issue only affects software that has been written to leverage specific deserialization functionality provided by the Spring Framework without sanitization.Spring Framework is vulnerable to a flaw in the access restrictions to the security sensitive `ClassLoader` property. The restrictions can be bypassed through alternative paths available with Java9 and later. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to cause remote code execution (RCE).

**Note** this issue exists because the restrictions that were introduced to prevent exploitation of BDSA-2010-0001 (CVE-2010-1622) can be bypassed on platforms where Java9 and later are in use.

This vulnerability is listed as exploitable by the Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency in their [Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog](https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog).Spring Framework is vulnerable to data binding protection bypass due to improper validation of specified disallowed fields in `DataBinders`. This could be leveraged by an attacker to bypass the suggested workaround to **CVE-2022-22965** (**BDSA-2022-0858**) if it is improperly implemented.Spring Security contains a flaw when dealing with OAuth2 access token empty scope list  responses. A remote attacker could leverage this to escalate their privileges under **all** the following conditions being met:

* They act as the role of a Login Client (e.g. uses `http.oauth2Login()`).
* They use one or more authorization rules with authorities mapped from authorized scopes (e.g. `anyRequest().hasAuthority("SCOPE_message.write")`) in the client application.
* An authorization server that responds with empty scopes list is registered (RFC 6749, Section 5.1).

**Note:** The role of Resource Servers (`http.oauth2ResourceServer()`) and applications that do not map authorization rules from authorized scopes (eg. `anyRequest().hasAuthority("ROLE_USER")`) cannot be exploited by this vulnerability.Spring Framework is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via specially crafted SpEL expressions. An attacker could exploit this issue by passing a crafted SpEL expression to the application which may result in a crash.Spring Framework is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via specially crafted SpEL expressions.This vulnerability is an expression language injection issue and affects VMware SpringSource Spring Framework  when a container supports Expression Language (EL) and evaluates EL expressions in tags twice, allowing remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via multiple attributes to carry out Expression Language Injection.Spring Framework contains a deserialization flaw. This could be exploited to bypass intended security restrictions. If successful, the attacker could pass and execute arbitrary commands on the vulnerable system.Spring Security is vulnerable to carriage return, line feeds (CRLF) injection in the logout functionality. Remote attackers can inject arbitrary HTTP headers and conduct HTTP response splitting attacks via the `spring-security-redirect` parameter.An XML External Entity (XXE) vulnerability has been discovered in Spring Framework. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting a malicious XML file to disclose information, execute server side request forgery (SSRF) or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.Spring Framework is vulnerable to XML external entity (XXE) injection due to insufficient security controls. An attacker could obtain sensitive information from system files by providing the application with a crafted XML document.This issue is present in multiple parts of spring framework, StAX `XMLInputFactory`, `SourceHttpMessageConverter`, and the Spring OXM wrapper using the `JAXB marshaller`. these issues are all problems with external entity resolution not being disabled, and use the CVEs: 

CVE-2013-6429
CVE-2013-7315
CVE-2013-4152

These issues were all worked on and were supposedly fixed in Jan 2014 (version **4.0.0** and version **3.2.5**), however it was later revealed that the fixes for these issues were incomplete, with a new CVE being assigned: CVE-2014-0054. The incorrect fix was corrected in versions **3.2.8** and **4.0.2**.An XML external entities (XXE) vulnerability has been discovered in Spring Framework. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting a malicious XML file to disclosure sensitive information, execute server side request forgery (SSRF) or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.Spring Framework is vulnerable to directory traversal due to the incorrect sanitization of client-provided URLs. An attacker could use crafted URL parameters to access any file on the system which is accessible to the process in which the Spring web application is running.

## CVE, BDSA IDs
CVEIDs 

BDSAIDs BDSA-2014-0108 BDSA-2014-0110 BDSA-2014-0111 BDSA-2015-0743 BDSA-2016-0002 BDSA-2016-1700 BDSA-2018-0994 BDSA-2018-1013 BDSA-2018-1016 BDSA-2018-1042 BDSA-2018-1440 BDSA-2018-1960 BDSA-2020-2431 BDSA-2021-2310 BDSA-2021-3236 BDSA-2022-0011 BDSA-2022-0847 BDSA-2022-0858 BDSA-2022-1040 BDSA-2022-3109 BDSA-2023-0638 BDSA-2023-0847 BDSA-2008-0003 BDSA-2011-0022 BDSA-2011-0024 BDSA-2013-0034 BDSA-2013-0035 BDSA-2014-0002 BDSA-2014-0106 BDSA-2014-0107

## Description
Spring MVC is vulnerable to XML external entity (XXE) injection as it does not disable external entity expansion by default and does not offer a way of disabling it manually. An attacker can leverage this flaw by sending crafted XML input to the server which may trick the XML parser into performing arbitrary operations on local resources that the attacker should not be able to control. This can lead to several problems ranging from an attacker being able to run stealth scans by bypassing the firewall, through sensitive information disclosure and denial-of-service (DoS), to server side request forgery (SSRF).

This CVE covers an incomplete fix to CVE-2013-7315.

NOTE: The fix to CVE-2013-6429 has also turned out to be incomplete (see BDSA-2014-0002 for details).Spring Framework is vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) due to a default action in Spring MVC that allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML to steal user's cookies.Spring Framework and Spring MVC are vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) due to a failure of a method to escape certain special characters from user-supplied input. In some cases it could result in an attacker being able to inject arbitrary web scripts and steal a user's session cookies.Spring Framework is vulnerable to a reflected file download (RFD) attack. An attacker can craft and send a URL with a `.bat` extension to a victim that results in the response being downloaded rather than rendered. Some input may also be reflected in the response.Spring Framework is vulnerable to path traversal. Paths provided to the `Resourceservlet` were not properly sanitized and as a result exposed to directory traversal attacks. `ResourceServlet` is now deprecated and `ResourceHttpRequestHandler` (and related classes) have superseded it.Pivotal's Spring Framework contains an unsafe Java deserialization vulnerability. If the Spring Framework library's `HttpInvokerServiceExporter` is being used to deserialize client data, it may be possible for a remote attacker to perform remote code execution (RCE) on systems using Spring Framework.

**Note:** All versions prior to **6.0.0-M1** (Which is a pre-release) contain the functionality that may lead to deserialization attacks depending on how the library is implemented in the product.Spring Framework is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied input. Potential attackers can leverage this flaw to run arbitrary code on the target system by sending crafted messages.Spring Framework is vulnerable to directory traversal due to the way static content can be loaded. Potential attackers could leverage this flaw to gain unauthorized access to sensitive files on Windows hosts.Spring Framework is vulnerable to privilege escalation due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input. Crafted input from a remote client can be used to exploit a flaw in the way that servers running the affected software communicate with each other. This is because communication between the servers uses that user-supplied input for building requests.Spring Framework is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied input. Potential attackers can leverage this flaw to run arbitrary code on the target system by sending crafted messages. Original remediation was not implemented correctly for the 4.3.x branch.Spring Framework has a flaw in the manipulation of regular expressions within the spring-messaging module. An attacker can send a specially crafted message to the simple STOMP broker that will trigger a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS).A cross-site tracing (*XST*) vulnerability has been discovered in spring framework. The application allows obscure request methods, such as TRACE and TRACK. These HTTP methods can be used with an existing cross-site scripting (*XSS*) vulnerability to escalate to an XST vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this by utilizing an XSS vulnerability to bypass cookie protection and steal sensitive data.It was discovered that Spring Framework was vulnerable to RFD protection bypass. * They use one or more authorization rules with authorities mapped from authorized scopes (e.g. `anyRequest().hasAuthority("SCOPE_message.write")`) in the client application.
* An authorization server that responds with empty scopes list is registered (RFC 6749, Section 5.1).

**Note:** The role of Resource Servers (`http.oauth2ResourceServer()`) and applications that do not map authorization rules from authorized scopes (eg. `anyRequest().hasAuthority("ROLE_USER")`) cannot be exploited by this vulnerability.Spring Framework is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via specially crafted SpEL expressions. An attacker could exploit this issue by passing a crafted SpEL expression to the application which may result in a crash.Spring Framework is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via specially crafted SpEL expressions.This vulnerability is an expression language injection issue and affects VMware SpringSource Spring Framework  when a container supports Expression Language (EL) and evaluates EL expressions in tags twice, allowing remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via multiple attributes to carry out Expression Language Injection.Spring Framework contains a deserialization flaw. This could be exploited to bypass intended security restrictions. If successful, the attacker could pass and execute arbitrary commands on the vulnerable system.Spring Security is vulnerable to carriage return, line feeds (CRLF) injection in the logout functionality. Remote attackers can inject arbitrary HTTP headers and conduct HTTP response splitting attacks via the `spring-security-redirect` parameter.An XML External Entity (XXE) vulnerability has been discovered in Spring Framework. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting a malicious XML file to disclose information, execute server side request forgery (SSRF) or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.Spring Framework is vulnerable to XML external entity (XXE) injection due to insufficient security controls. An attacker could obtain sensitive information from system files by providing the application with a crafted XML document.This issue is present in multiple parts of spring framework, StAX `XMLInputFactory`, `SourceHttpMessageConverter`, and the Spring OXM wrapper using the `JAXB marshaller`. these issues are all problems with external entity resolution not being disabled, and use the CVEs: 

CVE-2013-6429
CVE-2013-7315
CVE-2013-4152

These issues were all worked on and were supposedly fixed in Jan 2014 (version **4.0.0** and version **3.2.5**), however it was later revealed that the fixes for these issues were incomplete, with a new CVE being assigned: CVE-2014-0054. The incorrect fix was corrected in versions **3.2.8** and **4.0.2**.An XML external entities (XXE) vulnerability has been discovered in Spring Framework. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting a malicious XML file to disclosure sensitive information, execute server side request forgery (SSRF) or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.Spring Framework is vulnerable to directory traversal due to the incorrect sanitization of client-provided URLs. An attacker could use crafted URL parameters to access any file on the system which is accessible to the process in which the Spring web application is running.

rules.id: dom4j: flexible XML framework for Java 1.6.1 BDSA-2019-4386

shortDescription.text: BDSA-2019-4386: dom4j: flexible XML framework for Java 1.6.1

fullDescription.text: Dom4j is vulnerable to XML external entities (XXE) attacks.  This is due to the XML parser expanding XML entities by default.  A remote attacker that is able to supply input to Dom4j may be able to send crafted XML input that can be used to obtain file, upload content, or cause an impact on the availability of a system.dom4j contains an XML injection vulnerability that allows a remote attacker to modify XML content.  This can affect application using the framework that pass user-supplied data directly into `addElement` of `addAttribute` calls.

fullDescription.text: gson is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) and other potential confidentiality and integrity impacts due to the direct deserialization of certain internal classes. This vulnerability can be triggered when deserializing an untrusted `ObjectInputStream`.

CVEIDs

## Description
gson is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) and other potential confidentiality and integrity impacts due to the direct deserialization of certain internal classes. message.text: Apache Commons BeanUtils introduced a fix for BDSA-2014-0001 (CVE-2014-0114), however did not enable the protections by default. A remote attacker could leverage this to cause code execution in applications that did not use the new security feature.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text:
The Struts 1 ActionForm object allowed access to the `class` parameter, which is directly mapped to the `getClass()` method. A remote attacker could use this flaw to manipulate the `ClassLoader` used by an application server running Struts 1. This could lead to remote code execution under certain conditions, allowing unauthorised disclosure of information, unauthorised modification and disruption of service.

Apache Commons BeanUtils is distributed in `lib/commons-beanutils-1.8.0.jar` in Apache Struts **1.x** to **1.3.10** and in other products requiring commons-beanutils (to version **1.9.2**)

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Apache Commons contains a flaw that is due to the Base32 codec decoding  invalid strings instead of rejecting them. This may allow a remote attacker to tunnel  additional information via a base 32 string that seems valid.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: The apache commons collection (ACC) library, when utilized in an application that deserializes untrusted user input, is vulnerable to a remote attacker executing arbitrary code.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Apache Common Collections and Apache Synapse contain a vulnerability that allows for remote code execution (RCE) via crafted specialized objects. Failed attempts will cause a denial of service (DoS) attack.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Apache Commons Collection is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to the unsafe handling of in-memory data structures. A remote attacker could execute arbitrary code on the underlying system by submitting crafted data packets to a vulnerable server.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Apache Commons Collections has a security flaw in the `InvokeTransformer` class whereby serializable collections can be built that execute arbitrary Java code.  An attacker can achieve remote code execution (*RCE*) when untrusted user-provided objects are deserialized by applications that use Commons Collections.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Apache Commons FileUpload was discovered to be vulnerable to NULL byte poisoning due to the incorrect handling of filenames containing NULL bytes. The failure to check for NULL byte allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to upload or overwrite files on the system leading to unauthorized file modification, denial-of-service or remote code execution (RCE).

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text:
Apache Commons FileUpload does not sufficiently limit the the number of request parts that can be received via user input. An attacker can exploit this flaw by supplying a malicious upload or series of uploads and cause excessive resource allocation. This can trigger a denial-of-service (DoS).

**Note:** This vulnerability was not properly fixed in Apache Tomcat and required an additional disclosure as **CVE-2023-28709** (**BDSA-2023-1242**). The fix for Apache Commons FileUpload was not affected.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Apache Commons FileUpload is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to unsafe deserialization of Java objects. This could allow an attacker to write, copy and delete arbitrary files on a target system within the privileges of the application.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Apache Commons IO contains a path traversal vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this could allow an attacker access to files they do not have permission to view.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text:
Apache Log4j is vulnerable to a remote code execution (RCE) issue due to how the Apache Chainsaw component can unsafely deserialize user controlled input.

An attacker could send crafted input to the application in order to abuse the flaw and execute malicious code on the system.

**Note**: The Apache Chainsaw deserialization vulnerability has been reported as **CVE-2020-9493** and affects EOL Apache Log4j **1.2.x** versions that include this component.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text:
Apache Log4j **1.2.x** versions are vulnerable to SQL injection (SQLi). This may allow an attacker to insert SQL queries into messages being logged that will get executed against a backend database. 

**Note:** This issue  affects versions **1.2.x** that are configured to use the `JDBCAppender`. The vendor states that Log4j 1 is no longer maintained and this issue will not be fixed.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text:
Log4j is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to the deserialization of untrusted data. An attacker that is able to make the JMSSink component submit requests to a given LDAP server could load malicious Java classes into the vulnerable application's memory by leveraging the JNDI class-loading capability.

In order to exploit this vulnerability, the attacker must be able to control the configuration of Log4j, or must have access to an LDAP server which the JMSSink component is configured to use. Log4j must also be configured to utilize JMSSink, which is not used by default.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: Apache chainsaw is vulnerable to a deserialization of untrusted data flaw. A remote attacker could leverage this to cause remote code execution (RCE).

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text:
Log4j **1.x** versions are vulnerable to deserializing untrusted data if configured to use `JMSAppender` (which is not the default). A remote attacker could leverage this to execute arbitrary code on the underlying system with the privileges of the application that is running Log4j.

**Note** that Log4j **1.x** has been marked EOL for many years and has not received updates in this time.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: Apache Log4j is vulnerable to man-in-the-middle (MITM) attacks due to improper SSL certificate validation due to host name mismatch. An attacker could exploit this by mounting a man-in-the-middle attack which could leak log messages sent through SMTPS.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: Apache Log4j is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE).  This allows a remote attacker to send a crafted serialized payload that, when processed by Log4j, will execute arbitrary code. This can occur if Log4j is deserializing untrusted network traffic.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: Apache Log4j is vulnerable to man-in-the-middle (MITM) attacks due to improper SSL certificate validation due to host name mismatch. An attacker could exploit this by mounting a man-in-the-middle attack which could leak log messages sent through SMTPS.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text:
Apache Log4j, as used in many popular services, is vulnerable to improperly allowing lightweight directory access protocol (LDAP) access via Java naming and directory interface (JNDI). A remote attacker able to supply the end application with specially crafted input that is then processed by the Log4j subcomponent could cause the execution of arbitrary Java code.

**Note** 

- log4j-api packages by themselves do not contain the vulnerable functionality and are therefore unaffected. log4j-core packages and the upstream overarching source repository are affected.

- A previously suggested mitigation of setting environment variable `LOG4J_FORMAT_MSG_NO_LOOKUPS=true` is not recommended. This mitigation has been proven inadequate against this vulnerability. 

- This vulnerability is partially fixed in [**2.15.0-rc2**](https://github.com/apache/logging-log4j2/releases/tag/log4j-2.15.0-rc2) by [this](https://github.com/apache/logging-log4j2/commit/001aaada7dab82c3c09cde5f8e14245dc9d8b454) commit and [this](https://github.com/apache/logging-log4j2/commit/bac0d8a35c7e354a0d3f706569116dff6c6bd658) commit. These fixes were deemed incomplete. See BDSA-2021-3779 (CVE-2021-45046) for more details.

This vulnerability is listed as exploitable by the Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency in their [Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog](https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog).

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text:
Apache log4j is vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS) when uncontrolled recursion occurs through a self-referencing lookup.  An attacker can trigger a DoS with malicious input data that generates a recursive lookup  and consequent application crash.

Successful attacks require the attacker to have access to Thread Context Map (MDC) input, and for log4j configured with non-default pattern layout with a Context Lookup.

Only the log4j-core JAR file is impacted by this vulnerability. Applications using only the log4j-api JAR file without the log4j-core JAR file are not impacted.

Apache Log4j is the only Logging Services subproject affected by this vulnerability. Other projects like Log4net  are not impacted.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text:
Apache Log4j contains a remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability. This allows an attacker that has permissions to modify the logging configuration files to input a malicious JDBC Appender with a data source referencing a JDNI URI. This can then lead to RCE.

**Note:** This vulnerability impacts log4j-core.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Apache Struts contains an improper handling of URLs vulnerability within the Convention plug-in. This can be exploited by crafting special URLs to cause path traversal and arbitrary code execution.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text:
Apache Struts2 is vulnerable to code execution via parsing maliciously crafted XSLT files. An attacker able to upload such a file to the server, then view the file from the web server, can cause code execution in the context of the web server user or alter the application state.

**NOTE: Synopsys Security Team believe that additional versions of Apache Struts are vulnerable . The range of affected versions may be subject to change pending conclusion of Responsible Disclosure.**

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: Apache Struts contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker is able to enter a null value for a URL field within the `URLValidator` class due to an overly permissive regular expression. This can lead to a crash.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: Apache Struts is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to improper validation of user-supplied input in form fields. An attacker could exploit this issue by crafting a malicious URL.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: Apache Struts2 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting when using versions of the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) with a broken implementation of `URLDecoder`.  This could allow an attacker to steal tokens, session cookies, credentials or other sensitive information.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: Apache Struts contains an information disclosure vulnerability due to improper use of the Config Browser plugin within a production environment. An attacker could exploit this to expose application information.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text:
Struts is vulnerable to remote command injection through incorrectly parsing a web client supplied invalid Content-Type, Content-Disposition or Content-Length headers. These commands get executed under the Apache Web user. This is full remote command execution and is being actively exploited in the wild from the initial disclosure.

This vulnerability is listed as exploitable by the Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency in their [Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog](https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog).

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: If Apache Struts takes an URL in a form field and the built-in `URLValidator` functionality is utilized, an attacker can craft special input which will overload the server process. This leads to a denial-of-service (DoS).

message.text:

message.text:

This vulnerability allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on a vulnerable system with the privileges of the Apache Struts process.  This can lead to a total compromise of a systems confidentiality and integrity, and the possibility to cause a substantial availability impact also.

message.text: Apache Struts2 contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability.  This vulnerability requires an attacker to have the ability to upload a file to the server. Apache Struts 2 is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) through forced OGNL expression statements under certain circumstances. A remote attacker could leverage this to cause RCE in the context of the web server that hosts the vulnerable Struts application.

**Note**: This issue was not properly fixed and required an additional disclosure as **CVE-2021-31805** (**BDSA-2022-1011**).

This vulnerability is listed as exploitable by the Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency in their [Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog](https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog).

message.text:
Apache Struts2 is vulnerable to code execution via parsing maliciously crafted XSLT files. An attacker able to upload such a file to the server, then view the file from the web server, can cause code execution in the context of the web server user or alter the application state.

**NOTE: Synopsys Security Team believe that additional versions of Apache Struts are vulnerable . The range of affected versions may be subject to change pending conclusion of Responsible Disclosure.**

message.text:
Struts is vulnerable to remote command injection through incorrectly parsing a web client supplied invalid Content-Type, Content-Disposition or Content-Length headers. These commands get executed under the Apache Web user. This is full remote command execution and is being actively exploited in the wild from the initial disclosure.

This vulnerability is listed as exploitable by the Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency in their [Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog](https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog).

message.text:
Apache Struts is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE).  This vulnerability only manifests in certain configuration environments.  This vulnerability allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on a vulnerable system with the privileges of the Apache Struts process.  This can lead to a total compromise of a systems confidentiality and integrity, and the possibility to cause a substantial availability impact also.

This vulnerability is listed as exploitable by the Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency in their [Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog](https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog).

message.text: Apache Struts2 contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability.  This vulnerability requires an attacker to have the ability to upload a file to the server.  Under certain conditions, a remote attacker can then change the permissions of files and directories to read only.  This will prevent certain actions from working, causing errors.  This can be used to cause a denial-of-service.

message.text:
Apache Velocity is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) and arbitrary command execution due to how the SecureUberspector functionality does not sufficiently prevent access to dangerous classes and packages.

An attacker with the ability to modify Velocity templates could use this issue to execute arbitrary Java code or system commands with the privileges of the account running the Servlet container.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text:
Apache Velocity is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) and arbitrary command execution due to how the SecureUberspector functionality does not sufficiently prevent access to dangerous classes and packages.

An attacker with the ability to modify Velocity templates could use this issue to execute arbitrary Java code or system commands with the privileges of the account running the Servlet container.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Hibernate ORM is vulnerable to SQL injection due to the unsafe implementation of comments that are intended for debugging purposes. A remote attacker could potentially recover, modify or delete sensitive information that resides in back-end databases by submitting crafted requests that abuse these comments. It should be noted that only instances of Hibernate ORM that use a non-default configuration are affected.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: Hibernate ORM is vulnerable to SQL injection (SQLi) due to insufficient validation of user-controlled input. An attacker may be able to obtain unauthorized information from the database by executing arbitrary SQL commands.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: It was discovered that MySQL Connectors contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An authenticated remote attacker could exploit this to cause DoS via an application crash.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: Oracle MySQL connectors contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An authenticated attacker can take advantage of this to cause a frequently repeatable crash of MySQL connectors, as well as unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all MySQL connectors accessible data.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: An unspecified vulnerability has been discovered in MySQL Connectors `Connector/J` component. An attacker with high level privileges and network access via multiple protocols could exploit this in order to takeover MySQL connectors.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: MySQL Connectors is vulnerable to privilege escalation due to flaws in the component that facilitates communication between applications written in the Java programming language and a MySQL server. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerablility to gain greater privileges by providing the application with crafted input.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: A process takeover vulnerability has been discovered in MySQL Connectors. The weakness was discovered within the Java Database Connectivity (JDBC) protocol utilized by the system. An attacker with high level privileges and additional human interaction can takeover and compromise the MySQL connectors.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: MySQL Connector is vulnerable to information disclosure due to how clients handle a server's response to a connection request. An attacker could read files on a victim's underlying system by tricking them into connecting to a malicious server.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: It was discovered that with low success rate MySQL Connectors could be compromised by a remote unauthenticated attacker. This requires user interaction to successfully exploit.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text: It was discovered that MySQL Connectors could be used to compromise other systems. An attack that exploits this would be carried by a remote unauthenticated attacker and have a low success rate.

artifactLocation.uri: pom.xml

message.text:
Spring MVC is vulnerable to XML external entity (XXE) injection as it does not disable external entity expansion by default and does not offer a way of disabling it manually. An attacker can leverage this flaw by sending crafted XML input to the server which may trick the XML parser into performing arbitrary operations on local resources that the attacker should not be able to control. This can lead to several problems ranging from an attacker being able to run stealth scans by bypassing the firewall, through sensitive information disclosure and denial-of-service (DoS), to server side request forgery (SSRF).

This CVE covers an incomplete fix to CVE-2013-7315.

NOTE: The fix to CVE-2013-6429 has also turned out to be incomplete (see BDSA-2014-0002 for details).

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Spring Framework is vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) due to a default action in Spring MVC that allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML to steal user's cookies.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Spring Framework and Spring MVC are vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) due to a failure of a method to escape certain special characters from user-supplied input. In some cases it could result in an attacker being able to inject arbitrary web scripts and steal a user's session cookies.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Spring Framework is vulnerable to a reflected file download (RFD) attack. An attacker can craft and send a URL with a `.bat` extension to a victim that results in the response being downloaded rather than rendered. Some input may also be reflected in the response.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Spring Framework is vulnerable to path traversal. Paths provided to the `Resourceservlet` were not properly sanitized and as a result exposed to directory traversal attacks. `ResourceServlet` is now deprecated and `ResourceHttpRequestHandler` (and related classes) have superseded it.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text:
Pivotal's Spring Framework contains an unsafe Java deserialization vulnerability. If the Spring Framework library's `HttpInvokerServiceExporter` is being used to deserialize client data, it may be possible for a remote attacker to perform remote code execution (RCE) on systems using Spring Framework.

**Note:** All versions prior to **6.0.0-M1** (Which is a pre-release) contain the functionality that may lead to deserialization attacks depending on how the library is implemented in the product.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Spring Framework is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied input. Potential attackers can leverage this flaw to run arbitrary code on the target system by sending crafted messages.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Spring Framework is vulnerable to directory traversal due to the way static content can be loaded. Potential attackers could leverage this flaw to gain unauthorized access to sensitive files on Windows hosts.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Spring Framework is vulnerable to privilege escalation due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input. Crafted input from a remote client can be used to exploit a flaw in the way that servers running the affected software communicate with each other. This is because communication between the servers uses that user-supplied input for building requests.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Spring Framework is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied input. Potential attackers can leverage this flaw to run arbitrary code on the target system by sending crafted messages. Original remediation was not implemented correctly for the 4.3.x branch.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Spring Framework has a flaw in the manipulation of regular expressions within the spring-messaging module. An attacker can send a specially crafted message to the simple STOMP broker that will trigger a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS).

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: A cross-site tracing (*XST*) vulnerability has been discovered in spring framework. The application allows obscure request methods, such as TRACE and TRACK. These HTTP methods can be used with an existing cross-site scripting (*XSS*) vulnerability to escalate to an XST vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this by utilizing an XSS vulnerability to bypass cookie protection and steal sensitive data.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: It was discovered that Spring Framework was vulnerable to RFD protection bypass. In some instances, depending on the browser used, an attacker could bypass the RFD attack protections via the use of a `jsessionid` path parameter.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Spring Security contains an uncontrolled resource consumption vulnerability. Attackers could exploit this to create an `OutOfMemory` error and exhaust  system resources, triggering a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text:
Spring Framework is vulnerable to log file injection due to the insufficient validation of user input in an undisclosed component. An attacker could leverage this issue in order to add arbitrary entries to a log file which could impact both the integrity issues and performance issues.

**Note**: a follow-up to this issue was disclosed as **CVE-2021-22060** (**BDSA-2021-3236**), with further fixed releases that protect against additional types of input and in more places of the Spring Framework codebase.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text:
Spring Framework is vulnerable to log file injection due to the insufficient validation of user input in an undisclosed component. An attacker could leverage this issue in order to add arbitrary entries to a log file which could impact both the integrity issues and performance issues.

**Note**: the vendor states this issue exists as a follow up to CVE-2021-22096 (BDSA-2022-0011) that protects against additional types of input and in more places of the Spring Framework codebase.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text:
Software systems using Spring Framework may be vulnerable to unsafe deserialization if they employ unsafe use of certain provided deserialization functionality. A remote attacker could potentially execute arbitrary code on a vulnerable endpoint by passing a maliciously crafted serialized object to that endpoint.

**Note**: This issue only affects software that has been written to leverage specific deserialization functionality provided by the Spring Framework without sanitization.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text:
Spring Framework is vulnerable to a flaw in the access restrictions to the security sensitive `ClassLoader` property. The restrictions can be bypassed through alternative paths available with Java9 and later. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to cause remote code execution (RCE).

**Note** this issue exists because the restrictions that were introduced to prevent exploitation of BDSA-2010-0001 (CVE-2010-1622) can be bypassed on platforms where Java9 and later are in use.

This vulnerability is listed as exploitable by the Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency in their [Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog](https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog).

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Spring Framework is vulnerable to data binding protection bypass due to improper validation of specified disallowed fields in `DataBinders`. This could be leveraged by an attacker to bypass the suggested workaround to **CVE-2022-22965** (**BDSA-2022-0858**) if it is improperly implemented.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text:
Spring Security contains a flaw when dealing with OAuth2 access token empty scope list  responses. A remote attacker could leverage this to escalate their privileges under **all** the following conditions being met:

* They act as the role of a Login Client (e.g. uses `http.oauth2Login()`).
* They use one or more authorization rules with authorities mapped from authorized scopes (e.g. `anyRequest().hasAuthority("SCOPE_message.write")`) in the client application.
* An authorization server that responds with empty scopes list is registered (RFC 6749, Section 5.1).

**Note:** The role of Resource Servers (`http.oauth2ResourceServer()`) and applications that do not map authorization rules from authorized scopes (eg. `anyRequest().hasAuthority("ROLE_USER")`) cannot be exploited by this vulnerability.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Spring Framework is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via specially crafted SpEL expressions. An attacker could exploit this issue by passing a crafted SpEL expression to the application which may result in a crash.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Spring Framework is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via specially crafted SpEL expressions.

message.text: This vulnerability is an expression language injection issue and affects VMware SpringSource Spring Framework  when a container supports Expression Language (EL) and evaluates EL expressions in tags twice, allowing remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via multiple attributes to carry out Expression Language Injection.

message.text: Spring Framework is vulnerable to XML external entity (XXE) injection due to insufficient security controls. An attacker could obtain sensitive information from system files by providing the application with a crafted XML document.

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text:
This issue is present in multiple parts of spring framework, StAX `XMLInputFactory`, `SourceHttpMessageConverter`, and the Spring OXM wrapper using the `JAXB marshaller`. these issues are all problems with external entity resolution not being disabled, and use the CVEs: 

CVE-2013-6429
CVE-2013-7315
CVE-2013-4152

These issues were all worked on and were supposedly fixed in Jan 2014 (version **4.0.0** and version **3.2.5**), however it was later revealed that the fixes for these issues were incomplete, with a new CVE being assigned: CVE-2014-0054. The incorrect fix was corrected in versions **3.2.8** and **4.0.2**.

message.text:
Spring MVC is vulnerable to XML external entity (XXE) injection as it does not disable external entity expansion by default and does not offer a way of disabling it manually. An attacker can leverage this flaw by sending crafted XML input to the server which may trick the XML parser into performing arbitrary operations on local resources that the attacker should not be able to control. This can lead to several problems ranging from an attacker being able to run stealth scans by bypassing the firewall, through sensitive information disclosure and denial-of-service (DoS), to server side request forgery (SSRF).

This CVE covers an incomplete fix to CVE-2013-7315.

NOTE: The fix to CVE-2013-6429 has also turned out to be incomplete (see BDSA-2014-0002 for details).

artifactLocation.uri: package manager file path not available

message.text: Spring Framework is vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) due to a default action in Spring MVC that allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML to steal user's cookies.

message.text:
Pivotal's Spring Framework contains an unsafe Java deserialization vulnerability. If the Spring Framework library's `HttpInvokerServiceExporter` is being used to deserialize client data, it may be possible for a remote attacker to perform remote code execution (RCE) on systems using Spring Framework.

**Note:** All versions prior to **6.0.0-M1** (Which is a pre-release) contain the functionality that may lead to deserialization attacks depending on how the library is implemented in the product.
